description.value: A set of codes that define the method of admission to a hospital provider spell.

display.value: Admission Method not known
Elective Admission: Booked
Elective Admission: Booked
Elective Admission: Planned
Elective Admission: Planned
Elective Admission: Waiting list
Elective Admission: Waiting list
Emergency Admission: A & E or dental casualty department of the health care provider
Emergency Admission: Admission via Mental Health Crisis Resolution Team
Emergency Admission: Baby born at home as intended
Emergency Admission: Bed bureau
Emergency Admission: Bed bureau
Emergency Admission: Consultant clinic of this or another health care provider
Emergency Admission: Consultant Clinic, of this or another Health Care Provider
Emergency Admission: Domiciliary visit by Consultant
Emergency Admission: Emergency Care Department of another provider where the Patient had not been admitted
Emergency Admission: Emergency Care Department or dental casualty department of the Health Care Provider
Emergency Admission: General Practitioner: after a request for immediate admission has been made direct to a Hospital Provider, i.e. not through a Bed bureau, by a General Practitioner or deputy
Emergency Admission: GP: after a request for immediate admission has been made direct to a hospital provider (i.e. not through a Bed Bureau) by a General Practitioner or deputy
Emergency Admission: Other emergency admission

Emergency Admission: Other means, examples are: - admitted from the Emergency Care Department of another provider where they had not been admitted - transfer of an admitted Patient from another Hospital Provider in an emergency - baby born at home as intended
Emergency Admission: Other means, including admitted from the A & E department of another provider where they had not been admitted
Emergency Admission: Transfer of an admitted Patient from another Hospital Provider in an emergency
Emergency Admission: Via NHS Direct Services
Maternity Admission: Admitted ante partum
Maternity Admission: Admitted ante-partum
Maternity Admission: Admitted post partum
Maternity Admission: Admitted post-partum
Not applicable

Other Admission: Baby born outside the health care provider (except when born at home as intended. In this case the baby is an emergency admission. e.g. if midwife's decision to admit the baby use Admission Method 28)
Other Admission: Baby born outside the Health Care Provider except when born at home as intended
Other Admission: The birth of a baby in this Health Care Provider
Other Admission: The birth of a baby in this health care provider
Other Admission: Transfer of any admitted Patient from other Hospital Provider other than in an emergency
Other Admission: Transfer of any admitted patient from other hospital provider. May be used for an elective or emergency transfer from other hospital provider.
